column4: are you sure you deleted the ubuntu partition , or did you install windows after installing ubuntu and now you can't access
I am pretty sure I deleted the Ubuntu parition. Though I had that other problem that you stated quite a few years ago... :)
if you can find an app called easyBCD then you should be able fix the mbr on W7/Vista using that .
Just looked at easyBCD's website. Does it work when I am not able to boot into any OS at all?
I thought it was on a live-cd
Ok. Will read the guides. Thank you for the suggestion.
